content.p: Explain and demonstrate how to find the image of T and a basis for it.

outtro.p: \operatorname{Im} T = \operatorname{span}{{image}}, and a basis for it is {{image_basis}}.

content.p: Explain and demonstrate how to find the kernel of T and a basis for it.

outtro.p: \operatorname{Ker} T = {{kernel}}, and a basis for it is {{kernel_basis}}.

content.p: Explain and demonstrate how to find the rank and nullity of T, and why the rank-nullity theorem holds for T.

outtro.p: We have \mathrm{rank}={{rank}} and \mathrm{nullity}={{nullity}}. The rank-nullity theorem asserts that \mathrm{rank}+\mathrm{nullity}=\mathrm{dim}(\mathrm{dom}T), which we may verify as \mathrm{rank}+\mathrm{nullity}={{rank}}+{{nullity}}={{columns}}=\mathrm{dim}(\mathbb R^{ {{columns}} }).
